score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi network is moderately congested, impacting performance.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download worsened, upload stayed the same, ping worsened, networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your Wi-Fi experiencing random dropouts suggests interference or congestion is negatively impacting performance. A crowded network environment with multiple devices may contribute to this issue.

performance.interpretation: Your download speed is close to your ISP plan but slightly below the maximum, while your upload speed is within expectations. The ping is acceptable for a smooth experience but may fluctuate.

problems: High network congestion with 14 detected networks reducing stability.
Unoptimized 2.4GHz and 5GHz channel usage leading to interference.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to either channel 1 or 6 (less congested and with better RSSI).
Switch the 5GHz channel to 149 or 161, as channels 36 and 157 are congested.
Relocate the router closer to the center of the home to improve signal distribution.
Enable Smart Connect to allow the router to optimize device band assignment automatically.
Consider reducing the channel width to 40MHz on 5GHz for potentially less interference.
